translation2: I won't go. I'm just following the order. I haven't been contacted for over an hour. This is definitely an online scam. You think I'm a first-time food delivery person? After finishing the investigation, you're the one who said that! Before placing the order, I checked the address several times. I only placed the order after confirming it was correct. Thank you! How many days is it?

You said that after the investigation! I checked the address multiple times before placing the order. Okay, thank you! How many days?

translation2: Is a foot bath with bubbles and tingling feet a sign of leakage? Choosing an appropriate foot bath can bring good therapeutic effects, and today's US small editors will answer this question for you. With the enhancement of people's health awareness, foot baths have become increasingly popular among consumers, and a variety of products with different specifications have emerged on the market, ranging from hundreds of yuan to thousands of yuan, providing consumers with a wide range of choices. According to relevant data, foot baths and traditional household electrical appliances sell well, but foot baths do not have their own industry standards, so there are certain safety risks. "It's too dangerous to soak your feet in electric water!" Mr. Li told the reporter. Recently, he bought a foot bath as a gift for his father's birthday, but when his father soaked his feet, he felt tingling in his soles. Mr. Li initially thought it was caused by the vibration function of the foot bath, but after turning off the vibration function, his father still felt tingling in his soles. Mr. Li tried writing with a pen, and surprisingly, the pen lit up. Mr. Li discovered that the water in the foot bath was electrified. Later, he contacted the store, and the store's attitude was not bad, although he returned the foot bath, Mr. Li still felt unhappy. Because he found that there was no clear and detailed industry regulation on issues such as whether it can be used at the highest temperature, which groups of people it is suitable for, what materials are guaranteed to be safe, and so on. However, in general, foot baths do not have electrical problems, but it is not ruled out that some products may have been produced without strict quality control during the manufacturing process. Therefore, when purchasing, choose a disassembled foot bath. Water and electricity are separated, and there are no safety risks. You can also test with a pen at will.
gpt_response: { "Accuracy": { "Mistakes": [ "Addition: 'With bubbles' has been added in the first sentence of the text which is not in the reference text.", "Wrong Translation: 'US small editors' is incorrect, the original text referred to 'Gome', which seems to be a brand or company.", "Wrong Translation: 'Tried writing with a pen' should be 'Mr. Li used a tester', the pen does not convey the correct information.", "Wrong Translation: 'disassembled foot bath' is different from 'split type foot bath basin'. Both may have different technical meanings.", "Omission: The information 'the light on it was on' is missing from the evaluated text.", "Omission: 'sales of healthcare products such as feet bath basin was hot' information is missing from the evaluated text.", "Omission: 'the store's attitude was not bad' is vague and lack specific information that was present in the reference text as 'whose attitude was nice'.", "Omission: The reference text ends with 'you can use a tester to test it' which indicates use of a specific device for testing while the evaluated text suggests 'you can also test with a pen at will' which misses the specific device and intentionality of using it."]} }
reference: Does it mean there is leakage of electricity if my feet feel numb in the feet bath basin? Choosing the right feet bath basin can provide good pedicure and healthcare, and today Gome will answer this question; hopefully it will be helpful to you. As people care more about healthcare, feet bath basin has become more popular among the customers, and a large batch of products of different levels have emerged on the market, from a little more than 100 yuan up to a thousand yuan, giving the customers a lot of options. According to related statistics, compared with traditional home appliances, the sales of healthcare products such as feet bath basin was hot, but there is no specialized industry standard for feet bath basin and so there is potential safety risk. “Having a feet bath in the water with electricity is too dangerous!” Mr. Li told reporter that he recently bought a feet bath basin for his father as a birthday present, but his father felt that the bottom of his feet were numb when using it. Mr. Li first thought it was caused by the vibration function of the feet bath basin, and it was unexpected that his father still felt his feet were numb after turning off the vibration function. Mr. Li used a tester and the light on it was on; it was to Mr. Li’s surprise that the water in the feet bath basin was electrified. Then he contacted the seller, whose attitude was nice, but Mr. Li still felt upset although he had returned it. Because he found that feet bath basin, which has been popular for a long time, still has no explicit and detailed industry regulations on the setting of the maximum temperature, suitable crowd, what materials are safe to use, etc. But normally feet bath basin shouldn’t be electrified, however we can’t rule out the fact that a few products might not have been strictly checked before leaving the factory. Therefore, choose split type feet bath basin. There is no safety risk when water and electricity are separated. Meanwhile, you can use a tester to test it.

translation2: Chinese to English Translation:  A coalition of Asian-American groups filed a complaint with the U.S. Department of Education and the Justice Department on May 23, alleging that three Ivy League schools, including Yale University, Brown University, and Dartmouth College, discriminated against Asian-American applicants in the admissions process. Over 100 Asian-American groups submitted the complaint on May 23, protesting the discrimination against Asian-American applicants by these three Ivy League schools. The Asian American Education Foundation held a press conference in Washington on the same day to announce the lawsuit. The president of the coalition, Zhao Yuchun, said at the press conference that the number of Asian-American applicants who meet the admission criteria of these three Ivy League schools has increased tenfold in the past 10 years, but the proportion of Asian-Americans admitted has remained basically unchanged. Many studies have shown that these schools systematically and continuously discriminate against Asian-American applicants in the "holistic consideration" admission process. Zhao Yuchun introduced that a study by Sanders et al. in 2014 showed that among these three schools, the relative number of Asian-American applicants was the lowest among all ethnic groups, and the admission rate was the lowest. The data of the U.S. Department of Education also shows that among all Ivy League schools, Brown University and Dartmouth College have the lowest admission rate for Asian-American students, and Yale University and Brown University have implemented de facto racial quotas for Asian-American applicants for over 20 years. Zhao Yuchun told a reporter from Xinhua News Agency that they hope to submit the complaint and request the U.S. Department of Education and the Justice Department to investigate and take action to stop these schools from continuing to discriminate against Asian-American applicants in the admissions process. They also hope that the schools involved in the lawsuit will take this issue seriously and change their admission policies towards Asian-Americans. The three schools involved in the lawsuit have not yet responded. The Asian American Education Foundation was established in 2015 and previously filed a complaint against Harvard University's admission discrimination against Asian-Americans, but the U.S. Department of Education did not process the complaint for procedural reasons. This time, in addition to the Chinese-American groups, Indian-American, Japanese-American, Korean-American, and Pakistani-American education groups also participated in the lawsuit.
gpt_response: { "Accuracy": { "Mistakes": [ "Wrong Translation: The president of the coalition is named as 'Zhao Yuchun' in the evaluated text, whereas in the reference text the name given is 'Zhao Yukong'.", "Wrong Translation: In the evaluated text, the organization is referred to as 'The Asian American Education Foundation', whereas in the reference text the correct name is 'Asian American Coalition for Education'.", "Addition: The evaluated text refers to the complaint as a 'lawsuit' multiple times, whereas in the reference text, it’s referred to only as a 'complaint'."] } }
reference: Asian communities in the US complains about admission discrimination by Yale and two other Ivy League universities - Xinhuanet Message from Xinhua News Agency Washington on May 23 (journalist: Xu Jianmei): More than 130 Asian communities in the US submitted a complaint to the Ministry of Education and Ministry of Justice in the US on May 23 to protest against the discrimination on Asian students in the enrollment of 3 Ivy League universities, Yale University, Brown University and Dartmouth College. Asian American Coalition for Education, who initiated the complaint, held a press conference in Washington on that day. According to the speech made by Zhao Yukong, chairman of the group, during the past 10 years, the number of Asian applicants who met the admission qualification of famous universities in the US has doubled and redoubled; however, in these famous universities in the US, the proportion of Asian students basically maintained at the same level. According to lots of research results, these universities “discriminated against Asian students in a long-term, continuous and systematic way” during the so-called “comprehensive consideration”of the admission process. As introduced by Zhao Yukong, according to research results of scholars such as Saunders in 2014, in these 3 universities, Asian students have the lowest acceptance rate among all the ethnic groups considering the number of applicants. Data from Department of Education of the US also indicates that among all the Ivy League Universities, Brown University and Dartmouth College have the lowest acceptance rate of Asian students; Yale University and Brown University have been implementing racial quota of Asian applicants for more than 20 years. Zhao Yukong told the journalist of Xinhua News Agency that they wished that Ministry of Education and Ministry of Justice of the US could conduct investigation after they submitted the complaint, and take measures to prevent these universities from continuing to discriminate against Asian students in the admission process after identifying the facts. They also wished that the universities being complained about could pay attention to this issue on their own initiative and change the recruitment policy for Asian students. The 3 universities being complained about have not responded yet. Established in 2015, Asian American Coalition for Education once made a complaint against Harvard University about admission discrimination, but the US Ministry of Education did not accept the complaint on procedural grounds. In addition to Asian groups in the US, the groups involved in the complaint also include Indian, Korean, Japanese Americans and Pakistani education groups in the US.

It changes the context of what was 'wrapped up'.", "Omission: 'offer me a reasonable solution' is translated as 'give them a reasonable explanation', which changes the context and intent of the sentence from seeking a solution to delivering an explanation.", "Addition: The phrase 'please handle it well', was added in the evaluated text. This was not present in the reference text."] } }
reference: They have wrapped up. The number and name of your delivery person is #PHONENUMBER# and #NAME#. Please offer me a reasonable solution. Sure, but your delivery person has some issue that needs to be dealt with.

translation2: According to a report from the Xinhua News Agency on December 11, 2022, the number of graduates from universities in Beijing is expected to reach 268,000 in 2022, an increase of 16,000 compared to the previous year. At the 2022 Beijing Graduate Employment and Entrepreneurship Work Video Conference held by the Beijing Municipal Committee of Education and the Beijing Municipal Human Resources and Social Security Bureau, relevant personnel from the two departments announced the deployment of employment work for Beijing university graduates.  The personnel from the Beijing Municipal Human Resources and Social Security Bureau said that they would strengthen the matching of supply and demand, enhance policy support, broaden employment channels, ensure assistance for difficult cases, support innovation and entrepreneurship, and improve service efficiency in various aspects to deploy the employment work for Beijing university graduates.  The reporter learned that the Beijing Municipal Human Resources and Social Security Bureau would establish a practical platform, increase the number of job positions, actively contact 40 university graduate career experience bases, visit user units, and integrate demand and position information. They would focus on expanding the recruitment of the "six groups", including expanding the recruitment of civil service units, expanding the recruitment of state-owned enterprises, expanding the recruitment of grassroots projects, expanding the recruitment of military service, expanding the recruitment of internships and part-time jobs, and expanding the recruitment of innovation and entrepreneurship. They would implement dynamic management with "one policy for a lifetime" and recommend at least 5 job position information for each graduate, ensuring that all graduates with employment intentions receive assistance.
gpt_response: { "Accuracy": { "Mistakes": [ "Wrong Translation: The text incorrectly translates 'one policy for one student' to 'one policy for a lifetime'.", "Wrong Translation: The text incorrectly translates 'expand the batch of employment probation retention' to 'expanding the recruitment of internships and part-time jobs'", "Omission: The statement '100% of graduates from poor families with the willingness to work will be assisted' is missing in the text" ]} }
reference: The number of university and college graduates in Beijing is expected to reach 268,000 in 2022 - Xinhua News Xinhua News Agency Beijing December 11th (Reporter Yang Na) Reporter learned from the 2022 Beijing University and College Graduates’ Employment and Entrepreneurship Video Conference jointly held by the Beijing Municipal Education Commission and the Beijing Municipal Bureau of Human Resources and Social Security that the number of university and college graduates in Beijing is expected to reach 268,000 in 2022, increased by 16,000 compared with last year. Responsible person from Beijing Municipal Bureau of Human Resources and Social Security introduced that the employment of university and college graduates in Beijing will be deployed from the aspects of strengthening the matching of supply and demand, strengthening policy support, broadening employment channels, ensuring to provide assistance for those with difficulties, supporting innovation and entrepreneurship, and improving service efficiency. Reporter learned that Beijing Municipal Bureau of Human Resources and Social Security will establish a platform to increase work position supply, take the initiative to contact 40 job experience bases for college graduates, visit employing unit, and integrate demand information and job information; focus on the "six batches", that is, expand the batch of recruitment of institutions, expand the batch of recruitment of state-owned enterprises, expand the batch of recruitment of grass-roots projects, expand the batch of recruitment of military recruits, expand the batch of employment probation retention, and expand the batch of entrepreneurship to promote employment; implement the dynamic management of "one policy for one student", recommend no less than 5 jobs for each graduate, and ensure that 100% of graduates from poor families with the willingness to work will be assisted.
